column6: No comment
No comment

I've visited the Grotto BK on several occasions and each time I've always been impressed with their food and service. My favorite dishes are the Escovitch Shrimp, Grotto Pasta with Shrimp, and  their Mac + Cheese is 10/10!
No comment
No comment

I enjoyed my visit to the grotto! My favorite dish was the starfish and bake. They do have bottomless mimosas here which will definitely sneak up on you! You can also purchase hookah here guys! The spot is small but once you go to the back there's more room.
No comment

If you're looking for great decor and even better drinks, look no further! Came in on a Wednesday for happy hour and enjoyed their fruit punch, 2 for 1 during happy hour!! We sat at the bar and were greeted by the owners daughter and then got a chance to chat with the owner as well.  Very down to earth family and service was great! Great set up with their DJ and hookah. The place gets packed very quickly so be sure to grab seats early, they have a variety of menu items as well! We'll be back for hookah!!

The food was okay. I've had better shrimp and grits, the mimosas will get you drunk but the service was REALLY SLOW. It took forever to get our mimosa refills and brunch is only 90 mins so we probably each got 1 refill. We spent $83 each for brunch and it was not worth it. It's $40 for the unlimited mimosas PLUS the price of your meal which is something that should be explained because we all assumed it was $40 per person plus tax & gratuity. Even getting our water pitcher refilled took forever. Getting cups took a long time too. I don't know if it'll be worth it to come back to this place again. There's only seating in their outside area, the inside area is strictly a bar so no tables there. Our server was MIA most of the time we were there,  yet when it was time to pay the bill she hovered over us like we would run out on her.
No comment
No comment

I had such a horrible experience there. The seating is located in an uninstalled extension of the outside. I wore my coat the entire time. Food took 2 hrs to come, plastic plates, no knives, Did I mention I was freezing, those outdoor heating lamps are not pushing out enough heat. No one has any hospitality training, however, the food was good but the overall experience would not allow me to recommend this place...
No comment

Food was amazing ! I had curry goat rice and peas with cabbage  . Also had the shrimp appetizers the Thai sweet chili shrimp and the escovitch shrimp that I would highly recommend! Service was great! I will definitely be coming back! Great experience!
No comment
The food was amazing. I had the Rasta pasta and oxtail delicious. They also have drinks at reasonable price and hookah. I tend to go out by myself and the vibe was just right nothing

Unassuming ... seemed so quiet. I was unsure if they was still open for the night. But i pushed pass my awkwardness  and headed to the back and the backyard was a vibe. The drinks are strong even though i don't see a full bar. The food was definitely made fresh to order and flavorful. I was craving oxtails. I had a decent serving for what i see places serve these days. I asked for my rice to side and ordered mac n cheese. Mac n cheese was good.  It was alot of rice and tasted really good. I'm not sure who created that meme that Jamaicans dont make good rice cause that's a damn lie. My sister got the jerk nachos which also came out fresh to order and tasted very good. I have been in the cut lately due to covida and glad i got to  experience a new spot

The wings &  mac & cheese was amazing but the service was TERRIBLE. Was going to order an actual entrée but the appetizers took so long that we didn't even want to order any more food from there. It isnt the servers fault since she was covering a bunch of tables but as the customer it isn't fair to pay an automatic 20% tip when the server was not attentive nor did she offer water or utensils for our table we had to keep requesting for something as simple as napkins. But they included tip automatically even tho it was just a party of 3. So yea might just order take out from here but never dining in. The ambiance was okay everyone was frustrated on how long the food was taking. A customer was saying how he waited over an hour for 5 wings :/
No comment
No comment

I went to Grotto with a few of my friends for brunch and I'll start by saying I left full and we all left drunk. My chicken and waffles was good and so was my boyfriend's French toast. Now on to the not so stellar things. 1. The shrimp and grits was literally soup 2. There is only outdoor seating, inside is only a bar no tables. 3. They advertise 90 minutes of bottomless mimosas for $40 on the brunch menu but fail to mention that the $40 does NOT include food. 4. The service was super slow. In the 90 minutes I only got two mimosa refills because the waitress kept disappearing. But when it was time for us to pay she made sure to HOVER over us. Also they serve Caribbean food but had American hot sauce (Tabasco) which I found strange. All and all I would not go back.

The food is absolutely AMAZING!!! The is the perfect spot close to home! Always great vibes and friendly staff! The Mac & cheese is my absolute favorite! Everything on the menu is excellent! Brunch on Sundays are a hit! Love here and it's walking distance

I love The Grotto BK!  Listen! It's like having your parents busting it down in the kitchen! The food better than  good, it is AMAZING! Authentic Jamaican food at it's best!  The staff is helpful and pleasant and make you feel at home.

Met up with my new friend here after work. First off the place is small there was only 2 tables in the front and they only seat 2 ppl per table. Next, they took forever and a day to come and take our order we sat at the table for at least 30 minutes before our order was taken. Nowwwww the wait for our food was longer than the wait for them to take our order and to make it worse they only brought out my friend food and I had to wait another 20 minutes to get mines. Lastly the drinks were pretty good  my we had the coconut Caribbean drink really good, I notice it was a popular drink because the little ppl they had in there had the drink. Moving on to the food my friend had Buffalo wings and fries she said it was good, I had Oxtails, white rice, cabbage and sweet plantains the oxtails was pretty tuff  they didn't fall off the bone I had to fight to get the meat off the bone however the gravy and everything else was good they even give you gravy on the side for your rice. And, lastly the music was good...
Tomatoes, Tomatoes... waited over an hour for food that never came. When I finally asked the waiter how much longer do we have to wait for our food, they said they're getting started on it now.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Amazing little restaurant that makes the trek out to 2nd Ave so worth it!!!! The Peking duck is so juicy and flavorful, my mouth is watering just thinking back to this delicious meal. I came here with a party of 5 on a Tuesday evening, they sat us quickly even though our full party wasn't there yet which was very nice of them. Lamb skewers are a must, we strongly considered ordering a second order after finishing the first quickly. Their presentation is so beautiful, for example the Peking duck had an adorable tiny teapot that was "steaming". I'm not sure they did this on purpose but our scallion pancake wrapped ribs were cut into 10 pieces, a perfect amount for our group of 10. If they do this on purpose that's a very thoughtful touch. Can't wait to come back!

Solid, authentic Chinese food at a reasonable (for Manhattan) price! Of note are the Peking duck (well made and if you order a whole duck, it comes with delicious duck broth!) and the lamb skewers (absolutely delicious, definitely recommend). The whole fish we got was also very fresh. Scallion pancakes were meh. Overall, a great choice!
No comment

Yes the service can be a bit slow. Yes some dishes can be a bit salty. But how about one of the best peking duck I've had? The skin is crispy, yet the meat is so tender. The sauce is super flavorful. 10 out of 10. Other dishes were pretty good as well but you should not miss the peking duck
No comment
Peking duck is amazing, and they offer many different serving sizes. However, I do wish when I order a whole dock, it could be cut table side.
No comment
The best Peking Duck I've had in the city! Great food served with beautiful presentation.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Everything was delicious!  We enjoyed a whole peking duck (served with duck soup), beef fried rice,  house fried rice, shredded beef noodle, deep fried mini buns and vegetable dry bean curd edamame.  The edamame appetizer was SO good!!!   The duck was one of the best I've had- nice thin pancakes and great presentation.    Our only complaint is that we weren't given the bones.   Mini buns tasted like freshly made funnel cake.  This place is definitely a must try.  Bathrooms are clean and servers are attentive.
No comment

This is a low key Chinese restaurant that serves the BEST Peking duck in the city. Everything we ordered are very good too. The place is clean and have a private dinning room with minimum spending requirement. Service is great. Highly recommended!
First time peking ducks and absolutely liked it! Nice interior aesthetic design fancy styles of trying different dishes and delicious food!
Love this place! Skip the snow pea shoots (they were weirdly watery) but everything else was fantastic. Especially loved the duck. Highly recommend and will definitely be back!

I traveled all the way from Seattle to try this place out.  But they were closed and didn't even contact me.  I got a confirmation reminder a few days before my reservation time.  Very bad customer service
The peking duck was great, as were all the other dishes we got. Loved the more modern / fusion takes on traditional Chinese dishes. Service was also surprisingly good! Recommended!
Food was good! Peking duck was delicious and is a must try! Xiao long bao was good too!
No comment

Chef Huang's restaurant is the best new restaurant I have tried this year. Chef and his wife Summer have delicious food and great service, the restaurant was packed with people and it had a nice buzz. We loved everything we ordered. We will be returning next week to sample the rest of the menu

Delicious! I was told this restaurant opened not too long ago and it did not disappoint. The wraps for the Peking duck were so thin and authentic. My only wish is that they give more of the cucumbers and scallions to add into the wrap, but no big deal. The beef ribs in crispy pancakes were AMAZING. The beef ribs were so tender and highly suggest that as a possible starter. Highly recommend the Peking duck, soup dumplings, chef's special beef ribs with crispy pancake and lamb skewers, and house special noodles. They also give a complimentary soup when you order the Peking duck. Hopefully I'll be back! I also recommend making a reservation because it does get busy.

The best new Chinese restaurant in town. The Peking duck is absolutely perfect, the beef rib with  crispy pancake (similar to a puff pastry shell) was even better. The fried noodles are delicious. The service and presentation are spectacular. The plating is playful and elegant. No notes.
Very tasty.  Peking duck prepared perfectly.  Wish they would take reservations on weekends

i came here for a nice family dinner and we walked because it's close to my home when i first looked at the menu everything looked so tasty so i ordered some food and an orange juice obviously. the orange juice came before the food and i moved my face close to the straw and gingerly took a small sip. instantaneously i saw shapes and colors that i've never experienced before. my soul left my body and ascended into another dimension. safe to say this was the best orange juice i've ever had it's time for all other restaurants to take the L and stop selling orange juice bc honestly it's embarrassing for them to think that i would even consider buying their peasant orange juice. i would sooner off myself than order orange juice from an other establishment.

Authentic Chinese food with some interesting twist. One of the highlights was the fancy hand sanitizer. The duck was juicy but a bit cold. The lamb skewer was a bit chewy. Service could be improved but understand that they just opened recently.

Came here on New Year's day. Fantastic food! Had the Peking duck, beef skewers, beef stew with puff pastry, shrimp in mustard salad sauce (mayo). All were great! Staff are friendly and attentive but service a bit slow. Definitely coming back and recommending to everyone!
No comment
No comment
Best pecking duck I've had in a long time. All the dishes are absolutely delicious and the prices are very fair. Would recommend over and over again
In general not bad. The source for Beijing duck tastes a bit weird to me. Ambiance is nice and service is good.

Food was delivered late, it was ok, not great, beef was the same color as the chicken, ( was it veal or something else) lacked flavor , we had to doctor it up a bit with some soy sauce and sesame oil.

column3: Upper West Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment

Solid spot for a weekday dinner. The ambiance is decent and service was great. The food was very tasty but portions ran a bit small. I'd def come back for this dish that reminds me of chicken pot pie meats Korean kalbijim
No comment

A very welcome addition to the culinary scene in the neighborhood. This was our second time in two weeks. I recommend going after the usual lunch crowd to avoid the crowd because the place is small and gets filled fast. The duck soup was excellent and really hit the spot. The Peking Duck was easily the star of the day. The Spicy Crispy Shrimp was quite good too. Service was fast and pleasant. A little pricey but well worth it. Was a little disappointed that they were out of the soup dumplings but I guess that gives us an excuse to come back another time.

This roast duck in Manhattan can be said to be the most authentic Beijing flavor. The pancake and roast duck are delicious after one bite. The crispness of beef ribs and the unique flavor of beef make people admire it. Other dishes are also very good. Next time, you will come again!
Absolutely ridiculous Peking duck. In fact, everything on the menu is outstanding. Go go go!

The Peking duck was amazing as well as the soup dumplings. The service was great as the food came out very quickly. We loved the unique, soapy volcano (not sure how else to describe it) which was meant for us to clean our hands.
Delicious food, particularly the beef ribs and the duck. Definitely recommend going there!

We've only been once but we were disappointed. Our smoked fish hors d'oeuvre ($13) was oddly sweet, bony and dried out. A fried chicken noodle dish had not much flavor and almost no chicken. Luckily, an order of pea shoots was delicious.
No comment
Good food and even better presentation. I was pleasantly surprised by how amazing the dessert looked.  Food, service and presentation was outstanding,   Five star from me
No comment
No comment
No comment

Tried this spot recently and was able to chow down in a nearby park to get its full effect . Long story short , this is about average in taste . Chicken was towing that line on being dried out. The rice and peas wasn't the traditional type that's made with coconut milk. Although it was good on its own, the lack of coconut milk created a less soft rice and thus a further dry-er and less savory eating experience . To top it off the older lady was very succinct and not too  friendly in her service . It's a one and done for me .
No comment

The jerk chicken is so so good here! And the rice and salad that comes along with it, as others have said, is a good balance. Food is made fresh to order, the line moves quickly, and for what you get, the prices are right. Oh! It's also the perfect meal to pair with the beer that you can snag from Bed Vyne.
No comment
No comment

I don't get the hype! the rice is always super bland no flavor at all! when I got my jerk chicken it mostly had bones in it. I was expecting to eat a flavorful jerk chicken dinner and I got exactly the opposite. Three stars for the customer service.
I like the food And service. Have no complaints. Price is right too! The jerk chicken is not too hot. Mac n cheese is good too. A nice casual weekend eat!!
Had my mouth set on jerk chicken, I mean salivating!!! But it was lowkey a disappointment.
Great jerk chicken! Black owned. One of my fav Brooklyn spots.  High quality every time
No comment

Food was Mediocre at best. The owner is extremely "predatory" with women, often using the food as a means to get women to his place across the street. Most people looking for real jerk go to soldier not too far away. Beware of the charm, it's a me-too moment waiting to happen...women beware.

The service here is amazing! My friends and I were staying in Brooklyn for the weekend. One day on our way to Target we passed Wadadli and it smelled amazing! The next day we were so pressed to go and try the food. So, a little bit before noon we walked to the corner where it was located. We all wanted chicken, but it was not going to be ready for another 20 minutes. The chef gave us his number to preorder our meals and walked around Bed-Stuy. We came back 20 minutes later and he recognized us! And boy was it worth the wait! I ordered jerk chicken and it came with plantains, salad and rice & peas. Next time I'm in Brooklyn I will definitely be back at Wadadli.
Amazing food must try jerk chicken spot in Brooklyn. Jerk salmon is also great. They do catering as well
Food is always bomb and the owner always looks out! Fresh and tasty. Supports local business and the community plus BLACK OWNED!! My boyfriend & I LOVE Wadadli keep up the good work and great food.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Amazing food.   Great atmosphere.  Loved every dish.  Highly recommend it.   Best Yuca I've ever had.

Stop by this place for lunch one day and it was delicious!!!! The place is super cute with a nice backyard. The waitress was super nice and accommodating and let me charge my phone since it was about to die :/. Then o order The mezcal drinks which was well AMAZING! So I had two Hahaaha  of course. For lunch I had the shrimp tacos!! They were huge!!!! They were so good I wish I had more hahaha but I had to go! Definitely recommend this place! :)

Sunday brunch for 2. I'm not sure if it's inflation but $28 for duck confit chilaquiles (add egg) is a bit absurd especially for the amount of duck that is in the dish in proportion to the tortilla chips. Flavor was good though! You do pay for the ambiance and it was just what we were looking for on a rainy afternoon. It was cozy, and we were lucky to get last minute seating at the bar. I've only sat out in the back garden before so it was nice to get this change of scenery. One thing to note, if you are inside, the kitchen is also open air indoors, so anything they are cooking, you will smell like it. Near the end of our experience, something was being charred and that really smoked up the joint and made us want to leave quickly.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Looking for a cozy neighborhood eatery serving up some of the most delicious Latin American bites? Then check out Colonia Verde in Fort Greene, Brooklyn. The menu is loaded with amazing plates like the Shrimp Tacos, Brussels Sprouts Caesar Salad and Duck Confit Chilaquiles. While I loved the aforementioned plates, my absolute favorite bite of the meal was their Little Piece of Brazil Dessert - yuca coconut cake topped with homemade whipped cream and lime zest. Warm, savory and just the right amount of sweetness for a dessert. A perfect bite if you ask me. Colonia Verde is definitely on my list of best kept culinary secrets of Brooklyn.

Very few restaurants make me consider moving to a different neighborhood just to be closer to it. I don't know how people are raving about this place in their reviews and then only leaving four stars. Everything I had was amazing. Service was fantastic. Ambiance and decor were top notch. I'm pressuring my friends who live nearby to become regulars so I can constantly come back here. We had the sirloin, carnitas tacos, ceviche tostada, cauliflower chimichurri. Damn. They need to open one of these in my neighborhood.

This restaurant looked so good from the reviews and photos, but unfortunately was a big let down. The beet salad, burger and shrimp taco were all super mediocre. I eat some of the food, but only because I was really hungry and not because it tasted good.
No comment

Great outdoor ambience with space heaters! I love their brunch menu and their bottomless coffee. Their shrimp tacos is sooo good and great price for 3 tacos. Also their their chilaquiles with duck and definitely recommend it! Overall beautiful restaurant, great service, checks vax status and ID.
No comment
No comment

Really tasty! They ended up accommodating us for a walk in and we just had appetizers, but WOW. The carnitas taco was incredible - highly recommend to all. We can't wait to come back and eat everything else on the menu. Clams were a little salty but if you ate them with the bread on the side, they were good. If you're sharing the tacos, I'd recommend 1 order for every 2 people.
Good service and delicious food. Good cocktail list with mezcal, and a nice wine menu with skin contact wines as well.
Everyone could try everything, all of which was delicious including the wines. I'd definitely recommend this restaurant for the quality of the food, the atmosphere and the service.

I was really hopeful about this place but the food was kind of a let down. There was maybe one or two pieces of duck in the duck fried rice, and it tasted pretty meh overall...was definitely left wanting more. On the plus side the bartender was very friendly, and it has a nice ambiance, both inside and outside. Maybe the other dishes are a bit better than what I got, but won't be returning here again.

Food and service is always great. Underrated due to proximity to Evelina and other popular restaurants. But you can always sneak in for bar seating, nice drinks and food. Try the Pais wine for a light juicy dry red. Amazing steaks, and not bad options for vegetarians either. And last but not least.... The churros. Eat them.
No comment

WAITRESS HARASSED US ABOUT WHY WE DIDNT GIVE HER A HIGHER TIP!!!! The waitress was extremely rude all night. We had to ask her to clear our plates and flag her down for more drinks. She seemed bothered by our asking questions and was ... More
No comment

Made a reservation here to celebrate my friends birthday and it was excellent! The ambiance is so welcoming - it feels like you are in a lovely home with a stunning back patio. The cocktails are top notch! You definitely need to order the sausage and veggie parradillo as a starter. I will be back for sure.

I walked past this cozy restaurant last month while exploring DeKalb Ave and it's been on my list of "must go-to" restaurants ever since. I finally went last night and it was a perfect crisp autumn night. It was the most romantic dinner I've ever been to. The dim lighting throughout the whole restaurant was to die for ! The food was amazing and after I ate my tacos I still wanted more. I could've kept eating all night. I wanted to try everything on the menu. The food was so flavorful and unique. The drink I had was perfectly made. Everything was perfect to be honest. The cozy atmosphere was my favorite part. I already plan to be back here next weekend. I cannot wait to go back !!!
No comment
No comment
Great food and ambience. I'm Brazilian and the Brazilian influence in the dishes brought me back home! Lovely place. Delish!
No comment
No comment
No comment
